intro: Lomatium nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Lomatium nuttallii is often found in areas with well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
